Sure! Here are some specific shops and markets that you might want to check out when you’re in Graz:

1. Kunsthaus Graz shop: The Kunsthaus Graz is a contemporary art museum, and their shop features unique and creative items such as art books, prints, and jewelry.

2. Lendplatz Market: This market takes place on Fridays and Saturdays and has a great selection of fresh produce, cheese, meats, and other local delicacies.

3. Kastner & Öhler: This department store has been around since 1873 and offers a wide selection of clothing, accessories, and cosmetics from both international and local brands.

4. Glockenspielplatz Flea Market: Every Saturday, this square is filled with vendors selling antique and vintage items such as books, vinyl records, clothing, and furniture.

5. Herrengasse: This pedestrian street is home to many shops, cafes, and restaurants, and it’s a great place to wander and explore Graz’s shopping scene. Some notable shops include Steirertracht for traditional clothing, and Blicke-Reisen for unique travel gear.

I hope these recommendations help, and happy shopping!
